name: Ukraine

Media.evidence: A certain Ukraine Chinese Network exists that belongs to World Chinese Media, according to databases, but its presence in the public space is insignificant. Old info from before 2015 may be obsolete because a lot has changed meanwhile in the media landscape: first of all, disappearance of most printed newspapers and a shift in the public's media consumption as a result of various crises, the war and the moving of advertising in online. More recent analysis by Radio Free Europe has not detected a Chinese presence in the media space.

They exists formally, though the info about them is old and in the context of the war with Russia and Beijing's position on it, attitudes in UKR have toughened significantly, including in the media. Pro-Russian media / journalists were silenced, and to a large extent this network overlaps with the pro-China one, as the source quoted below makes clear. The media landscape in 2022 in Ukraine is quite different from 2021, not to mention previous years
We are aware of many cases when journalists visited PRC for study trips, however, there is no evidence that these received trainings there

Media.note: Most of the PRC media do not have a Ukrainian version, however, these have a Russian version which is understood by most Ukrainians

Media.evidence: Some information exists from a person in the media sector (influencer) that PRC-related entities have posted positive news in Ukrainian media; there is no official or public confirmation of this. Due to the current context in Ukraine, many public persons interviewed have reservations to be quoted
Media.note: Only marginal channels, in general online
There is a problem with tracking advertising paid by PRC since this is not made public and often one could determine it only by the very positive content

Media.evidence: We are not aware of any such cases

Media.note: There were several channels (ZIK, 112 Ukraine, NewsOne) which were more positive on China but there is no information that media in Ukraine censored views critical of the PRC

Media.evidence: This is not an issue of interest in Ukraine normally, with the multiple crises in the last years. However, we are not aware of such cases taking place

Foreign Policy.note: According to the source, the Ukraine-China friendship group is the largest friendship group in the parliament: 175 MPs out of 421. Morever, parties created an interaction group OBOR
Mostly under previous governments, but also recently in the pro-Russian regions / political groups

Foreign Policy.evidence: Ukraine never spoke publicly about this

The Ukrainian government has not change its one-China policy, latest affirmed in 2008. However with the things so much in flux it is difficult to confirm the current political stance of the present government
Ukraine has remained silent on the subject

Academia.evidence: Huawei has set up Seeds for the future program since 2016. Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, National University of Kyiv, Kyiv Mohyla Academy, Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, Kyiv National University of Technologies and Design are all included
Academia.note: An alliance of Ukrainian and Chinese Universities including 49 Ukrainian and 92 Chinese higher educational institutions has been created for closer cooperation in the field of education
Six Confucius Institutes and two Chinese classrooms in Ukraine
Chinese (mandarin) is not on the approved list for the education system

Academia.evidence:
The official webpages do not list any Ukrainian think tank or research center as part of PRC-affiliated networks. However, certain centers, such as the Association of Sinologists of Ukraine behave themselves as they would be part of this, which is completely loyal to China's interests in Ukraine.
There is also the V.I. Vernadsky Taurida National University but this is not under the control of Ukraine because it is in territory occupied by Russia for more that eight years (Crimeea), so the accuracy of information cannot be verified at source and the same institution appears in international databases as belonging to different countries

Academia.note: Wang Jing, the head of Chinese government-affiliated Skyrizon, created and funded several organisations in Ukraine, which were active in 2015–2019. These are the Ukrainian Silk Road Association “Silk Link,” which positioned itself as a “B2B2G platform for business and political cooperation between Ukraine, China and European countries,” the “Tianxia Link” Center for Contemporary China, which aimed at deepening relations between Ukraine and China, the Ukrainian House in Beijing, and Xinwei Ukraine. Both suspended their activity after the failure of Skyrizon to get control over Motor Sich

Academia.evidence: Олександр Денисов from Національна академія наук Україн (Natsional'na akademiya nauk Ukrayiny) was on the list of Thousand Talents Program 2012
Academia.note: The lists of the participants were not made public after 2018. According to Ukrainian experts, there are many talents from Ukraine who have been recruited through various programs, especially university programs in the area of engineering. Also, companies such as Huawei is organizing its "seed for future" program. However, experts note that in the last years the interest of China in Ukraine's talents significantly decreased and remaine mainly in the area of military R&D

Academia.evidence: Following interview with inside expert  the incident described in the indicator exists but there is no public available evidence
In Ukraine there has never been much public discussion about this, but this is unlikely to happen on large scale
Although experts note that visa bans for critical research could have happened, there is no evidence of this
No evidence for this and there are no many such academic programs anyway
Not much context for such discussions in class exists in Ukraine, and no such cases were reported.

Domestic Politics.note: Many regional authorties signed cooperation agreements with authortitiesin PRC and chinese companies.

Domestic Politics.evidence: According to experts, there are at least 91 agreemets between Ukrainian and PRC entities which envisage, in one way o another, sister-city ties.

Domestic Politics.note: A number of Ukrainian politicians attended (July 6, 2021) a forum organised by the Chinese Communist Party in Beijing.
There was not public or non-public information about this

Domestic Politics.evidence:
No evidence of such activity
Interview with expert
Domestic Politics.note: No public or non-public information about this

Ukrainian head of the governing party' faction in the parliament mentioned that his party and CCP have a lot in common and that Ukraine should use the positive experience of economic development of China. Also, high-level politicians participated in the presentation organized by the Chinese embassy of the Xi book
There were several cases when former diplomats would join Chinese companies

Domestic Politics.evidence: It is mostly about buying Chinese hardware which is them operated by local security services
Domestic Politics.note: On October 15, 2020, Ukraine’s State Service for Special Communications and Information Protection signed a memorandum of understanding with Huawei on cooperation in the areas of cybersecurity and cyber defense. According to the joint press release, the proposed cooperation aimed to strengthen Ukraine’s state defense against cyber threats, create a channel for information exchange, and provide advanced training for personnel in cybersecurity and communications

Economy.note: Overall volume of trade was $18.99bn - 13,4% of all trade of Ukraine. Export to China $8.01 bn and import $10.98 bn
Most of the debt belongs to IFI and in Eurobonds

Economy.evidence: Ukraine's top trading partner is the EU, but a breakdown by countries puts China on top as no. 1
Economy.note: Ukraine exported raw materials amounting to almost $14 billion in 2021. Out of this, the exports to China were about $3 billion. Therefore, most of the raw materials do not go to China but still, a significant part goes to China if considered per country

Economy.evidence: PRC owns certain assets in Ukraine's infrastructure, however they are not critical or strategic. Aside from the Mykolaiv port PRC also owns some large cereals companies, other agrobusiness firms etc. However, none of these are critical at this point, they cannot buy land (but just lease it) and found their assets trapped in the war zones of Eastern Ukraine. If PRC would have controlled Motor Sych factory, which was a transactions discussed for a number of years, then this would have been a company with significant industrial profile, but the deal was not approved by the Ukrainian government. This is a sign of the limited   Chinese influence in 2022 in spite of the high volume of purely commercial trade in 2021.
Economy.note: China does not own any strategic critical infrastructure
Ukrainian Chamber of Commerce is member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. At the same time, about 1100 Chinese companies opened their representations in Ukraine

China threatened to cut supplies of the vaccines and restrict trade if Ukraine does not withdraw its signature from the declaration on human rights in the Xinjiang - however this was not public and China did not impose trade restrictions since Ukraine withdrew its signature
As above, the reason for harassing Ukraine was the statement related to HR in Xinjiang

Technology.note: About 80–90 per cent of information and telecommunication equipment of Ukrainian mobile operators is manufactured by Chinese companies Huawei and ZTE, which also service and replace it

The Chinese companies participate in various state projects such as "safe cities" in Kyiv and Kharkiv and wi-fi for Kyiv Metro. The indicator is only an assessment; it is difficult to quantify with precision

Technology.evidence: Cameras in public spaces were installed years ago and they continued to function until short before the war. Reportedly some of these had facial recognition, but this is hard to confirm. It is not clear what happened to them after the Russian invasion in Feb 2022.

Technology.note: Kharkiv City Council and Huawei signed and memorandum on "Smart City" for Kharkiv
"At present, CIPS has 75 direct participants and 1,205 indirect participants. In Europe, the system’s direct participants are in London, Frankfurt, Zurich, Paris, Luxembourg, Hungary and Russia"

Technology.evidence: No info exists that such things may happen

Technology.note: TikTok in in top5 social netwroks in Ukraine (after facebook, youtube, instagram and twitter). Is thi what you mean under this indicator?

Technology.evidence: No info exists that such things may happen

Society.evidence: There may be such organizations in Ukraine but no public info exists at this point. In general such issues are not top priority on the public agenda in 2022, given the situation

Society.note: There is no information of any visits or cooepration with ACFTU taking place. However, there are ceratain cultural events at the organized by Ukrainian Federation of Trade Unions which promote China. For instance, in Nove,ber 2019 the Federation hosted a Chinese orchestra with a concert "One Belt - One Road".

Society.evidence: There is no evidence of UFWD personnel in Ukraine

Society.note: There is a cooperation at many levels in journalistic and cultural sphere. For instance, All-China Journalist Association has a program of annual exchanges with National Union of Journalists of Ukraine, including visits to China for Ukrainian journalists and to Ukraine for chinese journalists
Jack Ma financed the purchase of 1 million coronavirus testing kits for Ukraine at a cost of $80 million at the beginning of COVID pandemic

Society.evidence: We are not aware of any such case
China is a very rare topic for discussion in Ukraine. There opinions about China which prevail are mostly negative or neutral
China is a very rare topic for public attention in Ukraine

Society.note: Sometimes politicians promote Chinese narratives including positive comments about the need to adopt Chinese model of governance

In Ukraine there is no opinion poll measuring the views of Ukrainians towards PRC government. However, when asked to evaluate the importance of deepening cooperation with the countries, PRC is placed 12 with 76,4% (behind Poland, Germany, Canada, UK, USA, France, Turkey, Georgia, Lithuania, Sweden, Italy). But when asked whom should Ukraine support in the case of a conflict between US and China, 52,6% said US and only 10,6% said China

Military.note: Ukraine did not import military products (at least before the current war)
Ukraine supplied a wide range of military components for aircrafts (engines), navy ships, etc. It is estimated that before the war, the overall annual amount of exports was abut $90 million
Ukraine and China do not have join production, although such plans existed in the past. However, China is building certain military products based on technical documentation from Ukraine

Military.evidence:
It would also annoy Russia
expert interview

It would also annoy Russia
expert interview
We are not aware of any such case
We are not aware of any such case

Law Enforcement.evidence: According to official information, there is no such agreement that would qualify. Old data from before the invasion of Crimea in 2014 are obsolete because the security situation is completely different today
Law Enforcement.note: The List of international agreements of Ukraine does not include such an agreement

Law Enforcement.evidence: A case of infants trafficking involving Chinese nationals was reported in 2020, but it is likely that local gangs were organizing the whole thing while the Chinese nationals were trying to use the opportunity, without being part of the Chinese mafia as such. What is more, Ukraine has a quite liberal law on surrogate mothers, with 2500 children per year born as a result of such arrangements, some international (see article in link). In the confusion of the war many misunderstandings can occur in such cases

Law Enforcement.note: In most of the cases, the espionage refers to the military technologies

Investigation claims that more than 600 websites, including Ukraine’s defence ministry, were subjected to thousands of hacking attempts coordinated by the Chinese government prior to Russian war against Ukraine

Law Enforcement.evidence: We are not aware of such cases
At least one such case does exist, so the system seems to be in use

Law Enforcement.note: A citizen of PRC has been detained in Ukraine, at the request of PRC authorities, for his online comments over clashes between China and India. But the person was allowed to leave to the Netherlands. So, it is not entirely clear if this case falls under the indicator described

Law Enforcement.evidence: We are not aware of such cases
There are at least two known cases of risk of being extradited to PRC, but this did not happen in reality

description-1: In 2021, Ukraine had a GDP per capita of US$4,836 and a total population of 43.81 million people, with the Chinese population comprising 6,000 people (not including Chinese who are naturalized as citizens of host countries, or children born locally of Chinese descent).
description-2: Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1949. After Ukraine gained independence from the Soviet Union in 1991, the two countries forged formal diplomatic relations in 1992. Ukraine was ranked 106th in Reporters Without Borders' 2022 World Press Freedom Index, and partly free in Freedom House's 2022 Global Freedom Status, with a score of 61/100.
